decks.notes: This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through counterspells and removal spells like Fatal Push. It also utilizes graveyard interaction with cards like Thought Scour and Unearth. The creatures in the deck, such as Abhorrent Oculus and Psychic Frog, provide additional ways to control the board. The land base is optimized for fetching the necessary colors of mana and also includes utility lands like Undercity Sewers. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent by controlling the game and grinding out a win.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures and burn spells. The key strategy is to use efficient creatures like Amped Raptor and Guide of Souls to apply pressure early on, while also having access to powerful removal spells like Lightning Bolt and static Prison to control the board. With the support of cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Ocelot Pride, the deck aims to close out the game quickly by dealing damage to the opponent and securing victory.

The deck revolves around utilizing Underworld Breach and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to repeatedly cast spells from the graveyard, including The One Ring and Malevolent Rumble, in order to quickly assemble a powerful combo win condition. The inclusion of Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and control elements, while cards like Spell Snare and Boseiju, Who Endures help protect the combo pieces. Mishra's Bauble and Mox Amber provide additional ways to generate mana and delve deeper into the deck. Ultimately, the goal is to efficiently and effectively combo off to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach as a key combo piece to continuously cast spells from the graveyard, while also leveraging cards that untap lands like Deserted Temple and Lotus Field to generate mana. Other cards like Consign to Memory and Dream's Grip are used for disruption, while Wishclaw+Talisman','','');">Wishclaw Talisman provides tutor ability. Thassa's Oracle serves as a win condition by either decking opponents or winning with its triggered ability. The deck aims to speedily assemble the combo pieces and disrupt opponents long enough to secure a win.

This deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's game plan through a combination of counterspells, removal, and creature threats. It aims to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Sink into Stupor and Thought Scour, while also protecting its own threats with counterspells like Force of Negation and Counterspell. The deck also utilizes efficient removal like Fatal Push and Unearth to deal with opposing threats. The deck aims to take control of the game and eventually close it out with powerful finishers like Murktide Regent and Harbinger of the Seas.

This deck focuses on utilizing a variety of spells and creatures to quickly set up a powerful win condition without relying on traditional lands. By combining disruptive elements with mana acceleration and card advantage, the deck aims to assemble key pieces and combo off with cards like Goblin Charbelcher and Waterlogged Teachings to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck is designed to be fast-paced and proactive, aiming to win the game before the opponent can establish a strong board presence or find a way to disrupt the combo.

This deck focuses on utilizing a wide range of creatures to assemble powerful combinations that allow for control and disruption of the opponent's strategy. By carefully selecting and utilizing creatures like Malevolent Rumble, Grist, the Hunger Tide, and Sheoldred, the Apocalypse, the deck can manipulate the battlefield and generate incremental advantages over time. The inclusion of support cards like Shadowspear, Nihil Spellbomb, and Agatha's Soul Cauldron further enhances the deck's ability to disrupt opposing strategies and create advantageous board states. Ultimately, this deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a versatile toolbox of creatures and disruption spells.

The main idea of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly to play powerful Eldrazi creatures while controlling the board with spells like Kozilek's Command and Ugin's Labyrinth. The deck focuses on accelerating mana production with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Eldrazi Temple, and then using these resources to play devastating threats like Emrakul, the Promised End and Sire of Seven Deaths. The control aspect of the deck comes from cards like Malevolent Rumble and All Is Dust, which help to clear the opponent's board and maintain dominance throughout the game.
